message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.RO 

This paper discusses information-theoretic principles for learning and acting in Markov Decision Processes (MDPs), which are commonly studied in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG, cs.AI). The paper also introduces a generalized value iteration scheme and provides a convergence proof, which involves concepts from information theory (cs.IT) and control systems (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper discusses model uncertainty, which is a topic commonly studied in robotics (cs.RO). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.SY, and cs.RO, in that order.
